steps.content: Now, â€œdirty thirtiesâ€ refers to anyone living life to the fullest in their 30s. â€œDirtyâ€ isnâ€™t strictly sexual anymore and is slang for â€œfunâ€ (which could still definitely include sexual activities, but to each their own!). â€œDirty 30â€ also doesnâ€™t just apply to women anymoreâ€”anyone of any gender can celebrate their dirty thirtieth birthday or enjoy their dirty 30s. Youâ€™re really doing your dirty 30s right.â€ â€œGentlemen, hereâ€™s to the birthday boy and the dirty thirties!â€ Fun fact: The fact that â€œdirtyâ€ and â€œthirtyâ€ rhyme so well probably helped â€œdirty thirtyâ€ become a well-known slang phrase thatâ€™s separate from the purely sexual meaning.

steps.content: â€œDirty thirtyâ€ can also refer to a wild 30th birthday party. â€œDirty thirtyâ€ is a popular theme for 30th birthdays (youâ€™ve probably seen the hashtag #dirty30 in Instagram captions before) since 30 is kind of a weird milestone. steps.title: â€œDirty 30â€ is fun and lighthearted, but some may find it cringey or rude.
steps.content: â€œDirty 30â€ is fun and lighthearted, but some may find it cringey or rude. In general, wishing someone a happy â€œdirtyâ€ 30th birthday is just a fun way to acknowledge a milestone or post a (somewhat clichÃ©) caption with a birthday photo. However, some people think that â€œdirty thirtyâ€ is overused and that it feels cringey when someone says or posts about it (especially if the person or celebration is not super fun, adventurous, or â€œdirtyâ€ themselves). â€œDirty thirtyâ€ may also be offensive or inappropriate to some people. Some women interpret the original meaning as suggesting women in their 30s become more sexually active out of â€œdesperationâ€ or to feel younger (making the expression seem less empowering and more discouraging).

steps.title: The Dust Bowl of the 1930s
steps.content: The Dust Bowl of the 1930s In the 1930s, a severe drought struck the Midwest and southern plains of the United States and dried up the topsoil, leading to massive and devastating dust storms. These â€œblack blizzardsâ€ darkened the sky and caused dust to settle on the ground like snow, leading to the nickname â€œthe Dirty 30sâ€ for the decade. [2] X Research source

steps.title: A 30-milligram oxycodone pill laced with fentanyl or other drugs
steps.content: A 30-milligram oxycodone pill laced with fentanyl or other drugs In drug world, a â€œdirty 30â€ refers to a 30-mg oxycodone (Percocet) pill thatâ€™s been cut with fentanyl, heroin, or other drugs with a pill press. These pills are incredibly dangerous since theyâ€™re made to resemble genuine medication and the user may or may not know if they contain other illegal drugs. steps.title: A case of 30 cheap beers
steps.content: A case of 30 cheap beers â€œDirty 30â€ can also refer to a 30-rack (a case of thirty 12-oz beer cans) of cheap beer like Miller Lite, Keystone Light, PBR, or whatever you like. These light beers are often bought to play drinking games that require a lot of beer, like beer pong or flip cup . Since no oneâ€™s really savoring the taste, these beers are considered cheap and â€œdirty.â€ â€œDirty thirtyâ€ could also refer to a drinking game where players take a shot of beer every minute for 30 minutes (itâ€™s like doing a power hour , but cut in half).

steps.title: A 30-minute power nap
steps.content: A 30-minute power nap A quick power nap might be called a â€œdirty thirtyâ€ since youâ€™re just taking a quick, not-super-restful rest to go on with your day. Sometimes, this also includes some quick masturbation before the nap (adding to the overall â€œdirtinessâ€).

steps.title: A group of US army pilots during the Vietnam War
steps.content: A group of US army pilots during the Vietnam War In 1962, 30 US Air Force (USAF) pilots were sent to fly with the South Vietnamese Air Force (VNAF) 43rd Air Transport Group as advisors and co-pilots. Pilots were on duty 24/7 and performed 40-50 missions per month, meaning many of them basically lived in their flight suits most of the time. Another officer commented on how â€œdirtyâ€ the pilots were as a result, and they adopted the nickname â€œThe Dirty Thirty.â€ [4] X Research source
